§KElder Kings:§! Immortal and Dragonborn characters
Touched by fate
§G(Recommended)§! Those who cheat fate by becoming a false Dragonborn or Immortal will be punished by the Gods.
Unrestricted
The Gods won't punish those who betray their fate by obtaining the Dragonblood or eternal life while they were not chosen.
§KElder Kings:§! Reign of the Septims
Tiber Septim will spawn between 3763 and 3766 in the court of a random King or Emperor in Cyrodiil.
Tiber Septim can spawn at any time, but not before 50 years have passed.
Tiber Septim will never spawn.
§KElder Kings:§! Great Works Holding Limit
Capital only
Only the Great Works in your capital or which associated minor title has been given away are active.
Demesne only
Only the Great Works in your demesne or which associated minor title has been given away are active.
Any county
There is no restriction on who can hold Great Works.
The efforts to improve the infrastructure in [Root.GetName] bore their fruits. If we wish to, we can order our workers to keep working on it.
The efforts to improve the infrastructure in [Root.GetName] bore their fruits. It seems that we can't improve it much more.
Opinion of pro-necromancy faiths
Opinion of anti-necromancy faiths
Opinion of pro-lycanthropy faiths
Pseudo long-lived

This character greatly enhanced their life expectancy through magicka. While not immortal, they can expect to outlive most of the other members of their race by centuries.\n\nIs considered a §Ylong-lived§! character.
Magical health
Through magicka, this character greatly boosted their health. They can expect to live longer than their peers, and most diseases should be easily overcame.
Your special character title will be changed accordingly, should you have one.
Upgrade to Temple
I can upgrade [Root.GetFullName] to a proper Temple. If it is the County capital and the County is big enough, Castle and City Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist.
